content:
Is there anyone knowledgeable in ordinal arithmetic who could review #18611?

This PR defines the two argument Veblen function, such that veblen b enumerates the fixed points of veblen a for a < b, with veblen 0 a = ω ^ a. An immediate application is defining the epsilon function ε_ x = veblen 1 x. Later down the line, I also want to define the Veblen normal form for an ordinal, as well as its associated ordinal notation.
@Nir Paz @Daniel Weber
This has gone through two rounds of reviews, but has been stuck for two weeks.
